extendedIngredients.name: peanut butter chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup butterscotch or peanut butter chips

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 stick (8 tablespoons) unsalted butter, melted, plus more for buttering the dish
metaInformation: plus more for buttering the dish

recipes.title: Magic Bars
recipes.instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.                          Combine the melted butter and graham cracker crumbs in a small bowl with your hands (the mixture should hold together when squeezed). Pour the mixture into the prepared dish and press it into the bottom in an even layer, using the bottom of a measuring cup to help. Pour the sweetened condensed milk over the crumbs, then sprinkle the chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, pecans and coconut over the milk.                          Bake until the sides are golden brown and begin to pull away from the dish, 30 to 40 minutes. Let cool completely in the dish. Cut into 48 small pieces (they are rich). The cookies can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Combine the melted butter and graham cracker crumbs in a small bowl with your hands (the mixture should hold together when squeezed).
Pour the mixture into the prepared dish and press it into the bottom in an even layer, using the bottom of a measuring cup to help.
Pour the sweetened condensed milk over the crumbs, then sprinkle the chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, pecans and coconut over the milk.
Bake until the sides are golden brown and begin to pull away from the dish, 30 to 40 minutes.
Let cool completely in the dish.
Cut into 48 small pieces (they are rich). The cookies can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
